grass.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: a very common plant with thin leaves that covers the ground in fields and gardens and is often eaten by animals
grass.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: She enjoyed the feel of grass beneath her feet.
grass.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: All grasses need light to grow well.
grass.translation[0].definitions[3].defi: someone, usually a criminal, who gives information about other criminals to the police – used to show disapproval
grass.translation[0].note_box[0].section: cut the grass
The grass in the back garden needs cutting.
mow the grass
I usually mow the grass once a week.
green
The cows moved slowly through the long green grass.
tall/long
I walked with the tall grass brushing my knees.
These mowers only work efficiently on short grass.
coarse
The only vegetation was a few bushes and patches of coarse grass.
damp/wet
His foot slipped on the wet grass and he fell.
grass + NOUN
grass clippings/cuttings
You can use your grass clippings to start your own compost pile.
grass stains
It's going to be difficult to get the grass stains out of these trousers.
grass seed
Now is the best time to plant grass seed.
grass verge
He stopped the car on the grass verge of the deserted road.
a blade of grass
A few blades of grass poked out of the dry earth.
grass.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: to tell the police about a criminal’s activities
